problems.stem: A block is pushed to the right on a horizontal surface. In which direction does friction act?
problems.explanation: Friction always opposes the direction of motion or tendency to move. If the block tends to move right, friction acts left.

problems.stem: A block on an inclined plane tends to slide down. Which direction does friction act?
problems.explanation: Friction opposes the tendency to slide down, so it acts up the incline.
Static friction coefficient is typically larger than kinetic. It takes more force to start motion than to maintain it.

problems.stem: When can we use Fs = μsN (equality)?
options: Only when the object is moving
Only at impending motion (about to slip)
problems.explanation: Static friction is variable (Fs ≤ μsN). The maximum value Fs = μsN is reached only at impending motion.

problems.stem: A block sits at rest on a surface with μs = 0.5. If no horizontal force is applied, what is the friction force?
problems.explanation: With no applied horizontal force, there's no tendency to move, so friction is zero. Friction adjusts to balance applied forces.

problems.stem: A 80 kg crate sits on a floor with μs = 0.35. Calculate the maximum static friction force.
hints: First find the normal force: N = mg

problems.stem: What horizontal push force P is needed to cause impending motion of a 60 kg block on a surface with μs = 0.45?
hints: At impending motion, friction equals its maximum value
The push must overcome maximum friction

problems.stem: A block sits on an incline. If μs = 0.4, at what angle θ will the block be on the verge of slipping down?
A 20 kg block is on a 35° incline with μs = 0.5. Will it slip?
options: Yes, it will slip (required friction > max available)
No, it won't slip (max available friction > required)
problems.explanation: tan(35°) = 0.70 > μs = 0.5. The required friction to prevent slip exceeds the maximum available, so the block will slip.

problems.stem: A 30 kg block rests on a 25° incline with μs = 0.5. Determine if it will slip and find the friction force.

steps.description: Calculate the weight component parallel to incline (W∥ = mg sinθ)
Calculate the normal force (N = mg cosθ)
Compare: Since (Fs)max > W∥, the block does NOT slip. The actual friction force equals W∥.
